SEARCH
Package com.simulation.model

Class Task

java.lang.Object
com.simulation.model.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Task>
public class Task extends Object implements Comparable<Task>
Represents a computational task in the simulation system.

A Task represents a single unit of work submitted by a user. Each task has a unique ID, a task type (CPU or GPU), a user type (Normal, Personal VIP, or Enterprise VIP), and timing information.

Tasks implement Comparable to support priority-based scheduling. Priority is determined first by user type (Enterprise VIP > Personal VIP > Normal), then by arrival time (FCFS - First Come First Served) for tasks with the same priority.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Cloud Simulation Team

      taskType - the type of task (CPU or GPU)
      userType - the type of user (Normal, Personal VIP, or Enterprise VIP)
      arrivalTime - the simulation time when task arrives

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Task other)
      Compares this task with another task for priority ordering.

      Comparison is based on:

      1. User type priority (higher priority first)
      2. Arrival time (earlier arrival first, for same priority)
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Task>
      Parameters:
      other - the task to compare with
      Returns:
      negative if this task has higher priority, positive if lower, zero if equal priority and arrival time
